meanings.definition: Remaining after the greater part or quantity has gone.
meanings.sent1: The residuary amount of cake was too small for everyone to have a slice.
meanings.sent2: She found a residuary piece of paper at the bottom of her bag.
meanings.sent3: The residuary crumbs on the plate made a funny pattern.
meanings.sent4: His residuary energy was enough to finish the race strong.
meanings.sent5: The residuary glow of the sunset painted the sky in beautiful colors.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the residue or remainder of an estate.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer handled the residuary assets of the deceased.
meanings.sent2: The family discussed the distribution of the residuary inheritance.
meanings.sent3: The residuary mansion in the will turned out to be a tiny cottage.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the residuary charm of the old estate.
meanings.sent5: The scent of roses was the residuary fragrance of the garden.
